title: Retail inflation eases to four-month low of 5.22% in December - Moneycontrol
summary:
Retail Inflation Drops to Four-Month Low of 5.22% in December

Publication Date: January 13, 2025 / Source: Moneycontrol

India's inflation declined to a four-month low of 5.22 percent in December as food prices provided some reprieve.

  • Inflation reached 5.22% in December, down from 5.48% in November.
  • Food inflation eased below 9% for the first time in four months.
  • This marks the fourth consecutive month of inflation above 5%.
  • High inflation has influenced the Reserve Bank of India’s policy decisions.
"High inflation has been one of the reasons that the Reserve Bank of India has refused to budge on policy change."

This decline in inflation signifies a positive trend for the Indian economy, providing hope for better economic conditions ahead.
newTitle: Retail Inflation Drops to Four-Month Low of 5.22% in December

Sensex Crashes 1,100 Points, Investors Lose Over 14 Lakh Crore; Why Is Market Falling? - News18
summary:
Sensex Crashes 1,100 Points, Investors Lose Over 14 Lakh Crore; Why Is Market Falling?

Date: January 13, 2025

Source: News18

Indian equity indices BSE Sensex and Nifty50 plummeted on Monday, driven primarily by a strong US jobs report and concerns over slowing earnings growth, which dampened market sentiment.

  • The BSE Sensex fell over 1,100 points to a low of 76,250.
  • Market capitalization across all BSE-listed companies decreased by Rs 14.54 lakh crore.
  • Foreign portfolio investors (FPIs) sold equities worth over Rs 21,350 crore in January.
  • Global crude oil prices surged, straining India's fiscal health.
  • The Indian rupee hit an all-time low of Rs 86.27 against the US dollar.
“Markets are under pressure due to multiple headwinds,” said VK Vijayakumar, Chief Investment Strategist at Geojit Financial Services.

The steep market decline reflects broader economic pressures, including weakening corporate earnings and foreign selling, ultimately creating a challenging environment for investors.
newTitle: Sensex Experiences Dramatic Drop of 1,100 Points Amid Investor Losses

  • Shares opened at Rs 277.80, down from the previous close of Rs 280.55.
  • Intraday low was recorded at Rs 267.05, representing a nearly 5% decrease.
  • The stock has been declining for the last four days, losing a total of 11%.
  • Technical analysts suggest a weak structure; recommendations vary based on investment horizon.

Rail Vikas Nigam Limited (RVNL) has seen its share price drop 44% from its peak in July 2024. Experts suggest potential recovery based on strong order flows and recent shifts in stock classification.

  • RVNL shares peaked at ₹647 but are now trading between ₹348 and ₹365.
  • Analysts report that RVNL's fundamentals remain strong despite recent price declines.
  • Mutual funds are increasingly interested in RVNL following its move from mid-cap to large-cap status.
  • Technical targets suggest potential upside to ₹388 in the near term and ₹425 in the medium term.
  • Investors are advised to maintain a stop loss at ₹348.
“RVNL shares are under pressure, but nothing is wrong with the company's fundamentals.” - Seema Srivastava, Senior Equity Research Analyst

The RVNL stock presents a potential buy opportunity, especially for long-term investors looking to capitalize on the expected recovery.

summary:
Laxmi Dental IPO gets fully subscribed within 90 minutes on Day 1, retail portion booked 4x

Date: January 13, 2025 / Source: Moneycontrol

The Laxmi Dental IPO experienced a significant rush, fully subscribing within just 90 minutes on its opening day, with retail investors leading the charge.

  • The IPO size is Rs 698 crore.
  • Subscription reached 1.25 times within 90 minutes of opening.
  • Retail investors subscribed 4.26 times their allotted portion.
  • The non-institutional investors' portion was subscribed 1.76 times.
  • The Qualified Institutional Buyers (QIB) portion has yet to see any bids.
  • Price band set between Rs 407 and Rs 428 per share.
  • Investors can bid for a minimum of 33 shares, costing Rs 14,124.
  • Grey market premium stood at around 37%, indicating strong market interest.
"The portion reserved for non-institutional investors has been subscribed 1.76 times so far."

This enthusiastic subscription indicates strong demand and could bode well for Laxmi Dental’s future performance in the market.

title: Rupee breaches 86 against US dollar on strengthening dollar, weak FII inflows - The Indian Express
summary:
Rupee Falls Past 86 Against US Dollar Due to Strong Dollar and Weak FII Inflows

Date: February 7, 2025
Source: The Indian Express

The rupee opened at a record low of 86.12 against the US dollar as a strong dollar and foreign investor outflows weigh on the domestic currency, with higher crude oil prices exacerbating the situation.

  • The rupee fell to a fresh low of 86.31 on Monday.
  • Key factors for the decline include a robust US jobs report and a rising dollar.
  • Approximately $4.2 billion exited Indian markets in January 2025.
  • Current predictions suggest the rupee may trade between 85.80 and 86.50 in the near term.
“This sustained decline reflects a combination of global and domestic pressures.” - Amit Pabari, Managing Director, CR Forex Advisors

The combination of a strong dollar, increased crude oil prices, and capital outflows from foreign investors presents challenges for the rupee, necessitating careful monitoring of future economic policies.
newTitle: Rupee Falls Past 86 Against US Dollar Due to Strong Dollar and Weak FII Inflows

title: Delhi High Court refuses Gensol's request to restrain Mahindra from selling 'eZEO' EV - Bar & Bench - Indian Legal News
summary:
Delhi High Court Rejects Gensol's Bid to Halt Mahindra's eZEO EV Sales

Published on: 13 Jan 2025, 6:38 am

The Delhi High Court has denied Gensol Electric Vehicles' request for an injunction against Mahindra from selling its new Electric Vehicle (EV) 'eZEO'. The court found that Gensol did not provide sufficient grounds for the interim relief sought.

  • Gensol claims it owns the trademark 'eZio' and is concerned about potential public confusion with Mahindra's 'eZEO'.
  • Justice Amit Bansal dismissed the application noting the lack of a compelling case for an interim injunction.
  • The court has instructed Mahindra to respond to Gensol's claims within ten days.
  • Gensol plans to launch its 'Ezio' EV at the Bharat Mobility Global Expo 2025, while Mahindra's eZEO is designed for last-mile delivery.
"The applicant (Gensol) has failed to make a case for interim injunction. The application is dismissed."

In conclusion, the court's ruling allows Mahindra to proceed with the sales of its eZEO electric vehicle while Gensol prepares for its upcoming launch.
newTitle: Delhi High Court Rejects Gensol's Bid to Halt Mahindra's eZEO EV Sales

title: HPCL, Indian Oil and BPCL fall up to 7% intraday as Brent oil surpass $81 per barrel; check details - Upstox
summary:
HPCL, Indian Oil and BPCL fall up to 7% intraday as Brent oil surpass $81 per barrel

Publication Date: Not specified Source: Not specified

Oil marketing companies (OMCs) experienced significant declines as Brent Crude prices increased, affecting their stock performance. The report highlights the impact of rising crude oil prices on various companies within the sector.

  • The NIFTY Oil & Gas index dropped nearly 1% with most companies trading lower.
  • Hindustan Petroleum witnessed a drop of over 7% to ₹360.15 per share.
  • Indian Oil Corporation fell by over 5% hitting a low of ₹123.60 per share.
  • Global benchmark Brent Crude increased by nearly 2%, trading above $81 per barrel due to fresh US sanctions on Russian oil.
  • Higher oil prices are expected to negatively impact OMCs' margins.
  • Upstream oil companies showed mixed results with some gaining and others losing.
Experts predict that the US sanctions will limit Russian crude exports, pushing Indian OMCs to source oil from other regions.

This article outlines the immediate negative impact of rising oil prices on OMCs and the potential long-term consequences for their operations.
newTitle: HPCL, Indian Oil and BPCL fall up to 7% intraday as Brent oil surpass $81 per barrel

IREDA's share price saw a significant increase of over 5%, jumping as much as 5.51% to ₹212.30 on the BSE despite a broader market downturn, fueled by strong company guidance and expectations surrounding a ₹4,500-crore QIP.

  • IREDA's stock movement is linked to the announcement of tentative timelines for a ₹4,500-crore Qualified Institutional Placement (QIP).

  • IREDA is expecting to strengthen its capital base with the upcoming equity issue.
  • Analysts suggest holding IREDA shares with a stop loss at ₹190 and a target price between ₹230 to ₹240.
“The fundraising exercise aims to strengthen IREDA’s capital base and accelerate India’s transition to clean energy.” - IREDA Regulatory Filing

In conclusion, the positive signals from IREDA's management and strong quarterly results are positioning the company favorably in the renewable energy sector.

IndusInd Bank shares jump 4%, top Nifty gainer amid potential MSCI inflows - Moneycontrol
summary:
IndusInd Bank shares jump 4%, top Nifty gainer amid potential MSCI inflows

Date: January 13, 2025 / Source: Moneycontrol

IndusInd Bank shares rose by 4% to Rs 973, becoming the top gainer on the Nifty 50 index, following an increase in foreign headroom after a recent FII sell-off.

  • FII stake decreased from 55.5% to 46.6% in December.
  • Foreign headroom now exceeds the 25% threshold.
  • Potential doubling of MSCI weight anticipated to attract inflows of $250 million to $300 million.
  • The effects of this change are expected over the next 3 to 5 trading days.
  • The rebalancing and inflows will be seen on February 28, 2025.
“MSCI weight doubling is expected to attract inflows of around $250 million to $300 million.”

The surge in IndusInd Bank's stock is primarily due to the expected increase in MSCI weight stemming from a significant change in shareholding. This could lead to considerable investor interest and further stock performance in the near term.
newTitle: IndusInd Bank Stock Soars 4% Amid MSCI Inflows Potential

title: MC Exclusive | Must look beyond a few days of share price fluctuation: Ramesh Kalyanaraman of Kalyan... - Moneycontrol
Crude Oil on the Boil: HPCL shares fall 7%; here's how others are impacted - CNBCTV18
summary:
HPCL Shares Drop 7% Amid Rising Crude Oil Prices

Date: January 13, 2025 | Source: CNBC TV18

Shares of India's Hindustan Petroleum Corporation Ltd. (HPCL) have dropped 7% as crude oil prices surge, impacting other oil marketing companies and related sectors.

  • HPCL shares are down 7%, with Bharat Petroleum Corporation Ltd. (BPCL) and Indian Oil Corporation Ltd. (IOC) down 3% and 4%, respectively.
  • Brent crude has risen above $81 a barrel to its highest price in over four months.
  • The increases are linked to new US sanctions on Russian oil, affecting exports to top importers like China and India.
  • Other sectors, such as paints and tyres, also experienced stock declines due to rising oil prices.
"The new Russian sanctions... are a net addition to at-risk supply, adding more uncertainty to the (first quarter) outlook," - RBC Capital analysts.

The recent rise in crude oil prices and significant sanctions against Russian oil will likely have ongoing implications for the global oil market, particularly affecting major importers like India and China.
newTitle: HPCL Shares Drop 7% Amid Rising Crude Oil Prices

title: Rupee set for biggest single day fall in nearly two years: Key drivers explained - CNBCTV18
summary:
The rupee continued its decline for the second straight session on Monday (Jan 13), falling 27 paise to a record low of 86.31 against the US dollar.

Date: Jan 13, 2025 Source: CNBC TV18

The Indian rupee is on track for its steepest single-day fall since February 2023, hitting a record low against the US dollar. Here are the key drivers of this decline:

  • Strengthening US dollar: The dollar index climbed 0.22% to 109.72, driven by better-than-expected job growth in the US.
  • Surge in crude oil prices: Brent crude rose to $80.91 per barrel, increasing import costs and widening India's trade deficit.
  • Foreign fund outflows: FIIs sold ₹2,254.68 crore worth of equities on January 10.
  • Weak domestic market sentiment: The BSE Sensex dropped by 550.49 points to 76,828.42.
  • Declining forex reserves: India’s forex reserves dropped by $5.693 billion to $634.585 billion this week.
The rupee’s performance throughout the session will depend on global market trends, oil price movements, and domestic equity performance.

Forex traders warn of continued volatility with the US dollar expected to remain strong.
newTitle: Rupee Faces Largest Single-Day Drop in Nearly Two Years: Key Factors Behind the Decline
